attributes.action: David Cameron PM to serve Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty to Brussels
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron promised that he would do this when he spoke on the television whilst campaigning for his Remain Campaign.

Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty should be actioned, the general public won a majority vote of 52% of the votes and expect this promise to be executed.

David Cameron has relations with Brussels and he is best to serve this notice, Jean-Claude Juncker is also requesting Article 50 to be served.
attributes.background: Prime Minister David Cameron has previously stated that he would honour serving Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty to Brussels in the event that the vote was to Brexit from the EU.
